intro: Eriocaulon apetalum, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, grassy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy environments, often in tropical and subtropical regions. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in dense stands. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
